page.title: 08EASTON VILLAGE 2
page.content: There are no buses, shops, public houses, doctor or dentist, post office or school.The private Chapel went when the hall was demolished and the nearest church is at Stoke Rochford, in which parish Easton lies.The original school is now a private dwelling. No one seems to know where the stone cross came from or what it commorates.It is perhaps a small replica of original Eleanor cross but the story goes that when or if, the cross isv demolished the answer will be found underneath it.The public road from the Ermine Street to the East, ends at the cross and the following road to the A.1. is orivate to the Estate. Following the line of Ermine Street on the eastern side, is derelict railway line which used to carry ironore from the quarries at Colsterworth and Woolsthorpe to join
